question.text: Which of the following is incorrect about the uterine wall?

options.text: Perimetrium - Outer thin covering of peritoneum
Myometrium - Middle thick smooth muscle layer
Mesometrium - Smooth muscle layer below myometrium
Endometrium - Inner glandular layer that lines the uterine cavity

solution.text: The uterus is a part of the female reproductive system and is also known as the womb. It is an inverted pear-shaped organ that bears the foetus during pregnancy. The uterine wall has three layers which are perimetrium, myometrium, and endometrium. Perimetrium is the outer thin covering. Myometrium is the thick middle layer of smooth muscles and the inner layer which contains glands is called the endometrium. It is the endometrium that undergoes cyclical changes during menstrual cycle.
